titleStmt.title: Hugh O'Donnell et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9303

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: We the undersigned citizens would most Respectfully Represent to your Excellency that John Powell was at the Last June term of the Jackson Circuit Court sentance to the penitentiary for the term of two years charge with stealing of hogs) and the testing Seem to go to to his guilt) though there was some Evidence to the contrary

we will say to you that Mr Powel has Left a Large Family without any means to support on and we are of the opinion that you, if you will Pardon said Powel that you will only confirm the opinion of a Large Majority of the citizens of said county in his Innocence as there was much Feeling on the part of the Commonwealths witneses Manifested on the trial
